disize

Design informed size factor estimation (or disize) is a normalization method meant to be an alternative to DESeq2’s median of ratios and edgeR’s trimmed mean of M values

Usage

Take a look at the Get started page to familiarize yourself with disize.

Installation

As disize is not yet on CRAN, installation is not a one-liner with install.packages:

With remotes 

# Install disize
remotes::install_github("https://github.com/toddmccready/disize")

# Set up CmdStan toolchain
cmdstanr::install_cmdstan()

With rv

Add the following entries to your rproject.toml file (if not already present):

repositories = [
    # ...
    { alias = "STAN", url = "https://stan-dev.r-universe.dev" },
    # ...
]

# ...

dependencies = [
    # ...
    { name = "disize", git = "https://github.com/toddmccready/disize", tag = "v0.4.30" },
    # ...
]

Then install the CmdStan toolchain in R:

cmdstanr::install_cmdstan()
